type.name: org.gradle.api.plugins.quality.Pmd

method.name: getClasspath
method.description:
Compile class path for the classes to be analyzed.
The classes on this class path are used during analysis but aren't analyzed themselves.
This is only well supported for PMD 5.2.1 or better.

method.name: getIgnoreFailures
method.description:
Whether or not to allow the build to continue if there are warnings.
Example: ignoreFailures = true

method.name: getPmdClasspath
method.description: The class path containing the PMD library to be used.

method.name: getReports
method.description: The reports to be generated by this task.

method.name: getRulePriority
method.description:
Specifies the rule priority threshold.
@see PmdExtension#rulePriority

method.name: getRuleSetConfig
method.description: The custom rule set to be used (if any). Replaces ruleSetFiles, except that it does not currently support multiple rule sets. See the official documentation for how to author a rule set. Example: ruleSetConfig = resources.text.fromFile(resources.file("config/pmd/myRuleSets.xml")) @since 2.2

method.name: getRuleSetFiles
method.description: The custom rule set files to be used. See the official documentation for how to author a rule set file. Example: ruleSetFiles = files("config/pmd/myRuleSets.xml")

method.name: getRuleSets
method.description: The built-in rule sets to be used. See the official list of built-in rule sets. Example: ruleSets = ["basic", "braces"]

method.name: getTargetJdk
method.description: The target JDK to use with PMD.

method.name: isConsoleOutput
method.description: Whether or not to write PMD results to System.out.

method.name: reports
method.description: Configures the reports to be generated by this task.

method.description:
